Bilateral chronic serous otitis media.context: Postoperative Diagnosis: Bilateral chronic serous otitis media.

Insertion of Shepard grommet draining tu.context: 2. Insertion of Shepard grommet draining tubes.

Less than 1 mL.context: Estimated Blood Loss: Less than 1 mL.

persistent recurrent infections.context: The patient had a long history of persistent recurrent infections and was placed on antibiotics for the same.

small amount of thick mucoid material.context: At this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed.context: At this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

active acute infection.context: At this point in time, he had a small amount of thick mucoid material in both middle ear spaces with middle ear mucosa somewhat inflamed, but no active acute infection at this point in time.

operating microscope.context: With the patient under adequate general anesthesia with the mask delivery of anesthesia, he had his ear canals cleaned utilizing an operating microscope and all foul cerumen had been removed from both sides.

foul cerumen.context: With the patient under adequate general anesthesia with the mask delivery of anesthesia, he had his ear canals cleaned utilizing an operating microscope and all foul cerumen had been removed from both sides.

Bilateral inferior radial myringotomies.context: Bilateral inferior radial myringotomies were performed, first on the right and then on the left.

Floxin drops.context: Floxin drops were then instilled bilaterally to decrease any clotting within the tubes,

cotton ball.context: and then cotton ball was placed in the external meatus bilaterally.
